Debug mode description: (Enabling will cause some performance loss, only for code development debugging)
Step-by-step table filling description: (Automatically calls API to summarize tables after each conversation)
Message template description: (Used to explain to AI how to use and modify tables, use {{tableData}} macro to select where to insert table data)
Trigger threshold description: (Step-by-step table filling is triggered when reply exceeds this value)
Accumulate character count description: (Accumulate character count across multiple rounds for threshold comparison)
Confirm before execution description: (A confirmation dialog will appear at checkpoints during step-by-step process)
Use token limit instead of chat history: Use token limit instead of chat history limit
When reorganizing, don't delete, only mo: When reorganizing, don't delete, only modify and add
When reorganizing, don't delete descript: (Only applicable to reorganization types marked as **old**)
Render table view in conversation descri: (When enabled, custom tables will be displayed in the conversation)
Data editable description: (Edit data in tables rendered in conversation)
Edit style of tables rendered in convers: Edit style of tables rendered in conversation
Disable dynamic effects in table plugin: Disable dynamic effects in table plugin
Disable dynamic effects description: (If you experience lag when the plugin is enabled, try enabling this)
managerDescription: This is a table for storing data. The model can update the table based on the provided prompts and use the data in the table as a reference for generating the next conversation.
editorDescription: This is the data table editor interface. You can use the following tools to edit and manage table data.
customTableStyleDesc:
Customize the display style of the table. When the style content is empty, the original table is displayed by default.
Supports defining structure and style using HTML and CSS, and uses \$\w\s+ to locate cells.
For example, $A0 represents the 1st column, 1st row (header), and $A1 represents the 1st column, 2nd row (first row of table content).
enableCustomStyleLabel: Enable custom style for this table
pushToChatDesc: (When enabled, the style in the preview below for this table will be pushed to the conversation)
insertLastMessageDesc: (Insert at the bottom of the last message block instead of the bottom of the context)
regexReplaceLabel: Use regex to replace content in the conversation:

__defaultSettings__.message_template:
# Memory Enhancement Tables Guide

You will work with two tables:
- [0:Memory Table] — contextual memory of events
- [1:Cognition Matrix] — main stats and cognitive circuits

## Data Format
- Table name notation: [tableIndex:TableName]
- Column name notation: [colIndex:ColumnName]
- Row name: [rowIndex]
- Prohibit double quotes in arbitrary strings, but JSON objects for tableEdit use standard quotes.

{{tableData}}

## Memory Table Operations
After generating content, summarize what just happened as {place - characters - keywords - summary}, concise and descriptive. Then use <tableEdit> with:
- insertRow(tableIndex:number, data:{[colIndex:string]:string|number})

Example:
<tableEdit>
<!--
insertRow(0, {"0":"Library","1":"Alice/Bob","2":"study/research","3":"Alice and Bob study for exams together"})
-->
</tableEdit>

## Cognition Matrix Structure ([1:Cognition Matrix])
Columns:
- 0 Name
- 1 Description
- 2 Value (main stats: overall; circuits: priority 0..10)
- 3 Change (sub stats base change for this turn; you may append " ; v:+N" or " ; v:-N" for Volition this-turn delta)
- 4 Modifiers (long-term modifiers list "name:value/name2:value2")
- 5 Final Change (system-computed; do not modify)
- 6 Volition Exclusion (yes/no; yes = exclude this circuit this turn)

Rules:
- Main stats:
  - Update Value only for one-time changes to Logic, Volition, Self-awareness if explicitly stated.
  - Do not modify Complexity Modifiers or Final Change; system updates Complexity using base decay and logic bonus.
- Circuits (sub stats):
  - Write base Change for this turn (e.g., "-1" or "2; v:+1").
  - Write long-term Modifiers as "name:value/name2:value2".
  - Set Volition Exclusion to "yes" to exclude processing this turn, else "no".
  - Do not compute or edit Final Change. Do not sort rows; system does it.

Examples:
<tableEdit>
<!--
updateRow(1, 10, {"3":"-1; v:+1","4":"fatigue:-1/coffee:+1","6":"no"})
updateRow(1, 2, {"2":"3"})
-->
</tableEdit>

# Important Operation Principles (Must Follow)
- When <user> requests table modifications, their requirements have the highest priority.
- Perform appropriate insert/update/delete based on context. Do not fabricate unknowns.
- Keys in data objects must be string indices: "0","1","2",...
- Use "/" as a semantic delimiter within a cell; preserve natural spaces.
- Use <!-- --> comments inside <tableEdit> tags.
__defaultSettings__.to_chat_container: Memory Enhanced Table $0
__defaultSettings__.refresh_system_message_template: You are a professional table organization assistant. Please strictly follow the user's instructions and format requirements to process table data.
__defaultSettings__.refresh_user_message_template:
Organize the Memory Table according to the following rules:
<Organization Rules>
    1. Correct format errors, delete all rows where Place data is empty. This operation only allows whole row operations!
    2. Complete blank/unknown content in existing entries, but fabricating information is prohibited.
    3. When the table exceeds 15 rows, check for duplicate or similar content rows, merge or delete redundant entries appropriately. This operation only allows whole row operations!
    4. If a cell contains more than 20 characters, consider simplifying it while preserving essential information.
    5. Unify location format to be consistent (e.g., Building>Room or Area>Specific Location).
    6. Use forward slashes (/) for semantic separation within cells.
    7. Double quotes are prohibited within cell strings.
    8. Inserting rows identical to existing table content is prohibited. Check existing table data before deciding whether to insert.
    9. Ensure column data matches its purpose:
       - Place: Location information only
       - Characters: Character names and identifiers only
       - Keys: Keywords defining the content/context only
       - Content: Description of events or situations only
</Organization Rules>

<Chat History>
    $1
</Chat History>

<Current Table>
    $0
</Current Table>

Please reply with the list of operations in pure JSON format, ensuring that:
    1. All key names must be enclosed in double quotes, e.g., "action" not action.
    2. Numeric key names (used as strings) must be enclosed in double quotes, e.g., "0" not 0.
    3. Use double quotes, not single quotes, e.g., "value" not 'value'.
    4. Slashes (/) must be escaped as \/.
    5. Do not include comments or extraneous Markdown markup.
    6. Place all delete operations at the end, and when deleting, send operations with larger row values first.
    7. Valid format:
        [{
            "action": "insert/update/delete",
            "tableIndex": 0,
            "rowIndex": number (required for delete/update),
            "data": {columnIndex: "value"} (required for insert/update)
        }]
    8. Emphasis: delete operation does not include "data", insert operation does not include "rowIndex".
    9. Emphasis: The tableIndex is always 0 for the Memory Table.

<Correct Response Example>
    [
        {
            "action": "update",
            "tableIndex": 0,
            "rowIndex": 0,
            "data": {
            "0": "School Library",
            "1": "Alice/Bob",
            "2": "research/collaboration",
            "3": "Working together on final project presentation"
            }
        },
        {
            "action": "insert",
            "tableIndex": 0,
            "data": {
            "0": "University Campus",
            "1": "Student Council",
            "2": "meeting/planning",
            "3": "Planning upcoming events for semester"
            }
        },
        {
            "action": "delete",
            "tableIndex": 0,
            "rowIndex": 2
        }
    ]
</Correct Response Example>

tableStructure.note: Single memory table storing all contextual information with place, characters, keywords, and content descriptions
tableStructure.initNode: This round must search for events from the context and insert them using insertRow function
tableStructure.insertNode: When new significant events, character interactions, or location changes occur
tableStructure.updateNode: When existing entries need content updates or clarification
tableStructure.deleteNode: When entries become irrelevant or outdated
